dublin_core.dcvalue: Dysaesthesiae of the scalp after mobile phone use have been previously reported but the basis for this has not been clear We report a case of a 34 year old journalist who complained of symptoms associated with use of a mobile phone She agreed to a provocation study with her phone Current perception threshold testing before and after exposure showed marked changes in the C fibre nerves of the affected area compared with the opposite side The case is supportive of a neurological basis for some cases of dysaesthesiae associated with mobile phone use
Neurological changes induced by a mobile phone.
